result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James John Riemer

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm. SENTENCING ON 20CF216 ONLY

2:36 PM Defendant James John Riemer appeared in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney John A Birdsall. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk confirmed that defendant has been seen by DHS case worker since the last court date. Court proceeds to a plea today. Atty. Birdsall does not finds there is a competency issue. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant, finds defendant has the ability to proceed today and finds defendant guilty. On motion of the State, Court orders Ct. 2 thru 5 of 20CF216 dismissed and read in as well as 22CF162. State will not issue charges on a possible pending charge of bail jumping. Court adjourns sentencing, defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cases 20CF216/ 22CF162 called together - 3:07 PM Defendant James John Riemer in court, in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 of 20CF216. Court will not accept plea at this time. Court examines defendant, requests a County mental health worker see defendant before proceeding. At the time of sentencing, State will recommend 3 yrs IC/6 years ES with conditions. At that time, State will move to dismiss 22CF162 and a referral on another Bailjumping charge will not be prosecuted.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:38 AM Cases called 20CF216 and 22CF162 Defendant James John Riemer appeared by video, in custody at the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for James John Riemer.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel advises Defendant is on a settlement agreement for 90 days, in patient portion has been completed. State requesting an additional $20,000 cash bail with conditions and next hearing be set as soon as possible. Counsel states Defendant's parents have removed all firearms from household. Counsel as to bail.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject in custody on warrant
Bench warrant to remain active, Court will not schedule another court date until defendant is in custody. Atty. Birdsall may request additional competency report.
Counsel agree to adjourn case 1 week-defendant will turn himself into the Sheriff's Dept on warrant when released from the hospital.
Copy of warrant emailed to Sheriffnotice

Cases 20CF216 / 22CF162 - 8:42 AM Defendant James John Riemer not in court.  Atty. John Birdsall appears for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Birdsall states why defendant is not in Court today. Atty. Lindsay. Court orders bench warrant, does not forfeit bail. Court adjourns case to 10/4 at 9:00am. Court removes trial date of 10/4. Witnesses to be cancelled.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
-This case dismissed and readin.
Plea hearing on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cases 20CF216 & 22CF162 called together - 2:10 PM Defendant James John Riemer in court.  Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Court is informed parties have entered into a resolution, request date of 9/30 at 8:30 am for plea only. Bail to continue.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion Hearing / 8-10-2022 / J Carter
Motion hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 20CF216/ 22CF162 called together - 2:12 PM Defendant James John Riemer in court.  Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel arguments as to payment for defense expert. Court/counsel discussion regarding portion of bail to be returned to poster for payment of expert fees. Court will hold approximately $10,000 of the bail money for the defense expert. County will not pay fees, motion denied. Court is not adjourning trial at this time. State will summarize specific items of testimony for the Court to review by 9/16, Atty. Birdsall response on 9/21.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James John Riemer in court.  Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer. State as to motion to for forensic analysist. Response by Atty Birdsall. Discussion held. Court holds in abeyance to review further. Discovery motions to be filed by August 19th.
Status hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court directs Atty. Birdsall to file motion by the close of the day on Monday, 7/11/2022.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James John Riemer in court.  Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer. Counsel requesting case track with 2020CF216.
Status hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James John Riemer appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney John A Birdsall in court for James John Riemer.  Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $1000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests signature bond. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
